1001829583270772736.full_text: Born in 1930, Qiu Xiuying was hiding in a cellar with four family members when China’s then-capital was captured by the Japanese army in December 1937. Her mother was shot dead, the bullets piercing her shoulder and chest, when she left the cellar one day. #NanjingMassacre #WWII
